creator: slambert
title: Look Like Your Enemy: Create signs that confuse, astound and parody!
description: This project teaches you how to create signs that mimic the style of existing government or corporate signage in order to deliver a different message. This technique allows you to temporarily borrow the legitimacy of an organization for parody or artistic purposes.
steps: Choose a target sign that is reasonably accessible and whose modification won't cause confusion or damage.
Photograph the sign from a head-on perspective, ensuring accurate color balance and minimized distortion by zooming in slightly. Measure the sign's dimensions.
Import the photo into an image editor and straighten it, correcting distortion until the sign's edges are as straight as possible. Adjust image levels for accurate exposure.
Identify the fonts used in the sign using an online tool like WhatTheFont. Note the font names for later use.
Open your vector editing program and create a new file with the same dimensions as the target sign. Place the straightened photo on a locked layer.
Recreate the sign in the vector editor, using the photo as a guide for placement, color matching (using the eyedropper tool), and font sizes.

Print the design on an appropriate substrate, such as adhesive vinyl, using a large-format printer (if available). Alternatively, consider using vector-cut vinyl or tiling the design onto smaller sheets.
Install the new sign over the original, taking care to align it correctly.
